sentence: Mr. STANTON. Mr. Speaker, I was necessarily absent and missed three  votes on the House Floor today. Had I been present, I would have voted  YEA on Roll Call No. 172, H.R. 1998; YEA on Roll Call No. 173, H.R.  3394; and YEA on Roll Call No. 174, H.R. 3422.                             PERSONAL EXPLANATION
Ms. GILLEN. Mr. Speaker, had I been present, I would have voted YEA  on Roll Call No. 306 and YEA on Roll Call No. 307.                             PERSONAL EXPLANATION

Ms. GILLEN. Mr. Speaker, had I been present, I would have voted YEA  on Roll Call No. 322, NAY on Roll Call No. 323, YEA on Roll Call No.  324, NO on Roll Call No. 325, AYE on Roll Call No. 326, AYE on Roll  Call No. 327, AYE on Roll Call No.…
Mr. GOMEZ. Mr. Speaker, I was not recorded on roll call vote no. 71.  Had I been present, I would have voted ``YEA'' on roll call vote no.  71.

Mrs. SHAHEEN. Mr. President, while I voted nay on S. Res. 412, which  calls for an up or down vote on 108 nominations, en bloc, I would have  voted yea on the following nominations if I had the opportunity to vote  on each nomination separately:

1. Calendar Number 126: Leah Campos, of Virginia, to be       Ambassador Extraordinary…

Mr. SUBRAMANYAM. Madam Speaker, I regret that I was not present to  vote on Roll Call Vote No. 152. Had I been present, I would have voted  YEA on Roll Call No. 152.

Stated against:

…tools and information technology is a force multiplier that  augments and enables essential decision-support products.

Mr. Speaker, I urge my colleagues in the House to vote ``YEA'' on  H.R. 1325, the ``Commercial Remote Sensing Amendment Act of 2025.''

Mr. NADLER. Mr. Speaker, due to the blizzard in New York City, I was  unable to travel to Washington and I missed votes. Had I been present,  I would have voted YEA on Roll Call No. 71, YEA on Roll Call No. 72,  NAY on Roll Call No. 73, NO on Roll Call No. 74, YEA on Roll Call No.  75, and NAY on Roll Call No. 76.…

…1461 was cosponsored by the entire Pennsylvania congressional  delegation, Democrats and Republicans alike. I thank my colleagues for  their support, and I ask this Chamber's ``yea'' vote on H.R. 1461.

Mr. SMITH of Washington. Mr. Speaker, I missed today's votes due to a  flight cancellation. Had I been present, I would have voted NAY on Roll  Call No. 213 and YEA on Roll Call No. 214.                             PERSONAL EXPLANATION

…Call Nos. 265 and 266. Had I been present, I would have voted NAY on  Roll Call No. 265, the Republican Motion to Table the Democratic Motion  to Discharge H.J. Res. 117 and YEA on Roll Call No. 266, H.R. 3400.                             PERSONAL EXPLANATION

…and missed three  votes on the House Floor during the 1:30 p.m. series today. Had I been  present, I would have voted NAY on Roll Call No. 134, NAY on Roll Call  No. 135, and YEA on Roll Call No. 136.
Mr. THANEDAR. Mr. Speaker, had I been present, I would have voted YEA  on Roll Call No. 306.
Ms. DelBENE. Mr. Speaker, I necessarily had to miss the vote. Had I  been present, I would have voted YEA on Roll Call No. 305.
Ms. STANSBURY. Mr. Speaker, had I been present, I would have voted  YEA on Roll Call No. 72.

…Senator from  Kentucky (Mr. Paul), and the Senator from Alabama (Mr. Tuberville).

Further, if present and voting: the Senator from South Carolina (Mr.  Graham) would have voted ``yea,'' and the Senator from Tennessee (Mr.  Hagerty) would have voted ``yea.''

Mr. McCORMICK. Mr. Speaker, had I been present, I would have voted  YEA on Roll Call No. 56.

Mr. SCOTT FRANKLIN of Florida. Mr. Speaker, I missed the previous  question vote as I was in a constituent meeting. Had I been present, I  would have voted…
Mr. CARTER of Georgia. Mr. Speaker, I was unavoidably detained. Had I  been present, I would have voted YEA on Roll Call No. 194, YEA on Roll  Call No. 195, and YEA on Roll Call No. 196.

Mr. NEWHOUSE. Mr. Speaker, I was unable to vote on roll call no. 84  and no. 85 due to unavoidable circumstances. Had I been present, I  would have voted YEA on Roll Call No. 84 and YEA on Roll Call No. 85.                             personal explanation

Mr. TURNER of Ohio. Mr. Speaker, due to a flight delay, I was unable  to vote in the House today. Had I been present, I would have voted YEA  on Roll Call No. 335 and YEA on Roll Call No. 336.                             personal explanation

Mr. WOMACK. Mr. Speaker, I was unavoidably absent and unable to vote.  Had I been present, I would have voted NAY on Roll Call No. 333 and YEA  on Roll Call No. 334.                             personal explanation

…absent: the  Senator from Iowa (Ms. Ernst) and the Senator from Iowa (Mr. Grassley).

Further, if present and voting: the Senator from Iowa (Mr. Grassley)  would have voted ``yea.''
Mr. DAVIDSON. Mr. Speaker, I missed the first roll call vote in  today's vote series due to an important meeting with constituents. Had  I been present, I would have voted YEA on Roll Call No. 58.
Mr. CISCOMANI. Mr. Speaker, had I been present, I would have voted  YEA on Roll Call No. 57.
Mr. MEUSER. Mr. Speaker, had I been present, I would have voted YEA  on Roll Call No. 322.

Mr. HILL of Arkansas. Mr. Speaker, I was unable to vote because I was  in a legislative meeting which ran over. Had I been present, I would  have voted YEA on Roll Call No. 298.

Stated against:

Mr. NEWHOUSE. Mr. Speaker, due to a previously scheduled medical  procedure, I was unable to vote on Roll Call Nos. 265 and 266. Had I  been present, I would have voted YEA on Roll Call No. 265 and YEA on  Roll Call No. 266.                             PERSONAL EXPLANATION
Mr. PALMER. Madam Speaker, I was unavoidably delayed. Had I been  present, I would have voted YEA on Roll Call No. 137.

Mrs. HINSON. Mr. Speaker, due to flight delays, I missed evening  votes. Had I been present, I would have voted YEA on Roll Call No. 13,  YEA on Roll Call No. 14, and YEA on Roll Call No. 15.                             personal explanation

Mr. GRAVES. Madam Speaker, I missed a series of votes today. Had I  been present, I would have voted YEA on Roll Call No. 215 and YEA on  Roll Call No. 216.                             PERSONAL EXPLANATION
